page.title: 07The River Waveney.
page.content: The River Waveney has its source in Redgrave Fen and flows into the sea near Great Yarmouth.Beccles owes its existance to the river.In the past the river was the main source of trade for the town with the herring trade being most important in the middle ages. Nowadays a different trade has been built up around the river-that is tourism.Many holiday makers arrive in Beccles on hire boats. A large boat building trade has grown u on the banks of the river at Beccles. The Quay area has been developed to cope with the tourist trade. Many people living in Beccles own their own boat and moor it permantly on the river.In the summer they take trips up river for the day.The River Waveney is still a central part of life in Beccles.
